column1: He dreamed about his pleasant home far away in Italy. He thought he was with his little sisters
column2: and he saw his dear mother smile as she gave him his supper; but
column3: just as he was going to eat
column4: some sudden noise awoke him.He was frightened to find it was daylight
column5: and that the sun was high in the sky. In the doorway stood a kind gentleman looking at him. Pedro sprang up
column6: and took his fiddle; but the gentleman stopped him as he was going out
column7: and asked if that pile of shavings was all the bed he had. He spoke so kindly
column8: that Pedro told him his story.The gentleman felt so sorry for him
column9: and was so pleased with his sweet
column11: that he took him to his own home
column12: and gave him a nice warm breakfast; and
column13: being in want of an errand-boy
column14: he concluded to let Pedro have the place.Pedro has lived happily in his new home ever since; and
column15: though he still likes to play on his fiddle
column16: he has no wish to return to his old wandering mode of life.
